column4: Yeah, I was looking for that earlier today as well.. I have a webcam button, I want it to launch tvtime :(
theres calculator button/entries. :) use that one!
and copy the calculator program to the webcam program
what if I want to use the calculator button though?
Ohh, I have an IM button
bind that to the  Media player button! :)
I use all my media player buttons though!
actually im impressed that Ubuntu/Kubuntu normally has All these fancy buttons allready setup.
many disrtos dont do that at all.
Heh - the calculator button DOES popup the calculator

Less than half of mine are set up.. mail (although I use gmail.. can't find a way to make the mail button launch that for me) .. IM isn't.. webcam isn't .. 'logitech' does nothing.. search works, 'shopping' does nothing, 'star' does nothing .. 'home' starts firefox..
I got a cut/paste/copy buttons that dont seem to do squat. and a home button, and one with a folder with a *. (favorites) that are unbound.
I'm pleased the media/play/pause/stop/ff/rw/volume buttons all work though
would be cool if the keyboard shortcuts thing would let you bind any arbritrary key to launch any arbritary command .. but it doesn't :(
that would proberly be too confusing to new users  under gnome. :)
LESS is not always MORE!!! bloody gnome developers..
